item.title: Windows 11 KB5052093 update released with 33 changes and fixes
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has released the February 2025 preview cumulative update for Windows 11 24H2, with 33 improvements and fixes for multiple issues, including SSH and File Explorer bugs and the volume jumping to 100% when waking the PC from sleep. [...]

item.title: Windows 11 24H2 upgrades now blocked for some AutoCAD users
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has introduced a new Windows 11 24H2 upgrade block for systems with AutoCAD 2022, addressing compatibility issues that prevent the program from launching. [...]

item.title: Have I Been Pwned adds 284M accounts stolen by infostealer malware
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​The Have I Been Pwned data breach notification service has added over 284 million accounts stolen by information stealer malware and found on a Telegram channel. [...]

item.title: Firefox continues Manifest V2 support as Chrome disables MV2 ad-blockers
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Mozilla has renewed its promise to continue supporting Manifest V2 extensions alongside Manifest V3, giving users the freedom to use the extensions they want in their browser. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes Entra ID authentication issue caused by DNS change
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has fixed an issue that caused Entra ID DNS authentication failures when using the company's Seamless SSO and Microsoft Entra Connect Sync. [...]

item.title: GitVenom attacks abuse hundreds of GitHub repos to steal crypto
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A malware campaign dubbed GitVenom uses hundreds of GitHub repositories to trick users into downloading info-stealers, remote access trojans (RATs), and clipboard hijackers to steal crypto and credentials. [...]

item.title: Windows 10 KB5052077 update fixes broken SSH connections
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​​Microsoft has released the optional KB5052077 preview cumulative update for Windows 10 22H2 with nine bug fixes and changes, including a fix for a longstanding known issue that breaks SSH connections. [...]

item.title: New Auto-Color Linux backdoor targets North American govts, universities
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A previously undocumented Linux backdoor dubbed 'Auto-Color' was observed in attacks between November and December 2024, targeting universities and government organizations in North America and Asia. [...]

item.title: US drug testing firm DISA says data breach impacts 3.3 million people
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: DISA Global Solutions, a leading US background screening and drug and alcohol testing firm, has suffered a data breach impacting 3.3 million people. [...]

item.title: Anthropic's Claude 3.7 Sonnet is here and results are insane
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Anthropic has started rolling out Claude 3.7 Sonnet, the company's most advanced model and the first hybrid reasoning model it has shipped. [...]

item.title: Orange Group confirms breach after hacker leaks company documents
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: A hacker claims to have stolen thousands of internal documents with user records and employee data after breaching the systems of Orange Group, a leading French telecommunications operator and digital service provider. [...]

item.title: OpenAI bans ChatGPT accounts used by North Korean hackers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: OpenAI says it blocked several North Korean hacking groups from using its ChatGPT platform to research future targets and find ways to hack into their networks. [...]

item.title: Russia warns financial sector of major IT service provider hack
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Russia's National Coordination Center for Computer Incidents (NKTsKI) is warning organizations in the country's credit and financial sector about a breach at LANIT, a major Russian IT service and software provider. [...]
